content:
So @Josh Triplett and I were discussing the ideas of how to manage lang-team RFCs after the lang team meeting today. I think we nailed down the last few things I was debating about, and I took some time to write it up. You can find the RFC draft here (it still has some unfinished areas):

https://github.com/nikomatsakis/project-staged-rfcs/blob/master/rfcs/0001-shepherded-rfcs.md

This is basically an attempt to overhaul the "Pre-RFC" period. I'd love to get thoughts.

cc @T-lang, @T-lang/WG-meta
Oh, cc @Steve Klabnik too, I know you're interested in this sort of thing :point_up:
I wonder a tiny bit about using the main github org and such but like, whatever
It is hugely beneficial to use the main org -- team repo sync is pretty great.
